inn1.comm: whangs it back of a length outside off at 135 kph, and Amla lets it go.
closer to the stumps, and the pace is on the rise - 139 kph - and pushes Amla back. He punches it into the covers
and again, good lengths from Shoaib, touches 140 kph this time as Amla looks to force it off the back foot. Can't get it away though, through the off side
Shoaib slips and Amla clips. This time Shoaib slides onto Amla's pads and he prompty picks it off the hips behind square for four. Razzaq wasn't moving fast enough int he outfield to cut it

shot of a man in prime form. This was perfect length, Amla had no business driving that, but managed to generate tremendous bat speed as he stayed beside the line and drilled it through the covers. The only thing better than the timing was the placement. No one had a chance
good comeback. Shoaib sends in the bouncer and Amla arrests the forward movement at thye last moment, to weave away. It still grazes him on the ribs and goes away to the off side.
back of a length outside off and Kallis lets it go through
good length again, Kallis stays back and sees it go without much carry
and now Kallis tries to manufacture something by prancing across and coming out of the crease. Gets closer to the length and works it to the leg side, but straight to mid on
stays back this time and defends solidly into the covers
Kallis again skips out and looks to drill Razzaq through the covers. On the bounce to the man at short cover
finishes with a regulation off cutter that comes back into Kallis and forces him to play back. Maiden from Razzaq
beaten by the pace. That was in the slot for the pull and Amla went for it, but at 142 kph, it was through him in a flash.

lovely change in pace, 111 kph and back of a length. Completely flummoxed Amla who was into his forward defensive before it came. It nudged the inside edge and went close to the stumps, but Amla survives
pushes Kallis back with a short of length ball outside off and Kallis guides it into the covers

Rip-snorter. That was a dragon and it breathed fire as it took off from a length and shaped away from Kallis' meek attempt to steer through the off side. Absolutely thuds into Haider's gloves. Monster at 143 kph

bowled im! The two-card trick very nearly got Amla, but it has got rid of Kallis comprehensively here. Another slow off cutter, 111 kph, and you could never make it out from Shoaib's action. The follow through was non-existent as he stood and watched expectantly after releasing the ball. Kallis was hours early into the prod and ended up back-spinning the defensive shot onto the stumps. It landed on the castle and Shoaib puts his arms up. Classy stuff!
full and fast gunning for Ingram's toes, but he keeps it out to midwicket. We have just witnessed a thoroughly enjoyable over here
Amla guides a fullish ball outside off to the right of the keeper. Haider fumbles and allows the single
Razzaq lands it on a length at 126 kph and takes it across Ingram's nervous waft outside off. No edge taken.
crisp stuff. Ingram stands tall on his toes and punches it from outside off through the covers, past the man at short cover. Ingram is away
clever variation from Razzaq who bowls it fuller and draws Ingram into a drive, He is early on the shot and it goes off the inside half to the bowler
pushes him back again outside off and Ingram keeps it out to the covers
works a back of length ball on the hips through midwicket for a couple. He has the gift of timing, does Ingram
pushes Amla back with a fast delivery angling in from outside off. Amla defends to the off side
this one nips into Amla from outside off and he uses the angle to work it behind square on the leg side
142 kph and fullish outside off. Poor bounce on that as Ingram gets the drive on the bottom of the bat towards mid off

this is slow and this is sensational! Shoaib does it again, off cutter, floated up at 122 kph and Ingram is early into the drive yet again. Chips the dolly in the air, straight at Shoaib, who almost like a spinner with a muted follow through, was waiting for it. He pouches it and hurls it into orbit. Ingram is on his way.
snother full and fast delivery on and outside off. AB handles it well
just outside off this time and AB is circumspect as he plays back and opens the face. It goes off the outside half behind point for one
AB does a Kallis, jumping across outside off and coming forward. He was still not close enough to the ball that Razzaq pinged well outside off. Misses the edge and goes through to Zulqy
this time AB is more sedate, staying on leg stump and shouldering arms as it carries through to the keeper
hint of inward seam, off 124 kph and AB thrusts the front pad across and plays around it for a single towards midwicket
keeps it slower, 122 kph and back of a length. Amla stays in the crease and works it to the leg side

Shot. Not a four, but that is such a special shot. Not driving length, not short enough to cut, not fast enough to use the pace either. Amla stays beside the line and punches the back of length ball, on the up, and through the packed off side cordon. It slows up in the outfield and they pick three
AB steps out, but Razzaq holds it further back and forces the batsman to defend to the off side
full and angling into the batsman, Amla stays in the crease and plays watchfully to the leg side
a bit of room outside off but still short. Amla can't time the cut and plays it out straight to the covers
good shot and very good fielding. That swerved into Amla's pads on a length and he timed the on-drive well towards wide mid on. Tumble and save keeps it down to one
143 kph as Shoaib coaxes more life out of this dead pitch. It lifts off a length and thuds into Zulqy's pads again as AB leaves
that's 144 kph - Shoaib's fastest ball of the day so far - AB was beaten for speed as he poked outside off. It whizzed past the outside edge, close to willow, close to timber, but not close enough.
Not really this time as Shoaib keeps him guessing with another lifter outside off. Through to Zulqy as AB lets it go
Razzaq gives nothing to drive and Amla tries to work it off the back foot into the off side. Can't find the gap
Amla this time does a Kallis, and does it well. He hurries out to the line of off stump and comes out of the crease. He is well inside the line now and helps the length ball over midwicket for four
slower ball, fullish at 107 kph and Razzaq rolls the fingers over it. Amla opens the face and guides for a single to third man
good stuff from Shafiq, these Pakistanis are a-buzzing! AB crunches out a well-timed cover drive and it was headed to the boundary until Asad dived across to his left from cover to stop it
slow off cutter - 109 kph - but AB spots it and drives crisply down the ground. Razzaq fields on his follow through
another slower one angled into AB who nudges it square for one
shot. Driving length and AB drives on the up into the covers for a couple. Crisp bit of timing that.
forces AB back into the crease with one that angled into the body. AB rides the bounce and deflects it to the leg side for one
slower ball, but this time Amla is waiting as it goes through outside off. Runs it very late off the face of the bat for a couple to third man
fast and furious outside off and Amla is up to it as he rasps out a cut shot. Straight to Alam at point though, and no run taken
back of a length outside off and Amla is working hard to gauge the pace of this wicket. Pulls the bat back to guide this one to third man instead of cut it square. Single taken.
AB deals with Shoaib in his own way, trying to work everything from off and middle to the leg side. Can't get it away this time though
another floater from Razzaq outside off and Amla steers it fine for another single to third man

Ajmal this time, the fielding from Pakistan is the best I have seen in a long time., Razzaq drifts onto AB's pads and he times the on-drive perfectly. It was always going to beat Ajmal running to his right from mid on, but he lunged and stretched and tumbled to stop it.
Amla again runs it from outside off for a single to third man. Razzaq is wary not to drift into Amla's body.
back of a length outside off and AB tried to drive on the up through the covers. And finds out that's not very easy on this pitch as it dribbles out to mid off
fuller on off stump and AB gets into a half-hearted check drive this time. Straight to covers, so another dot ball
into AB's pads and he will be a little disappointed that he did not time that whip too well. Picks a single backward of square leg for one
begins pretty well, with one that deviates from off stump and leaves AB completely beaten on the forward prod.
fuller on off stump and AB defends into the covers
holds it back of a length at 132 kph and AB gauges the length well this time to pull out a robust punch. Straight to mid off though
closer to the stumps, pushing AB back with a short ball that angles into the body. AB plays around it but keeps it out to the leg side
AB is early on the drive and it takes the inside edge. Runs out to midwicket. Riaz has begun well here
another one right on the money, angling across AB from middle towards off. AB stays back and meekly defends. Riaz has begun with a maiden
tossed up on off and Amla drives to long on for one
AB reaches out and works him from outside off to midwicket for one
full on the stumps from round the wicket and Amla looks to clip him to the leg side. Can't get it away
this time he does, neatly worked off the pads towards square leg
tight on middle and straightening into AB who works it back to the on side of the pitch
looped up generously on leg and AB works it uppishly but safely through mid on for one
Wahab angles another one across the right hander and AB wants nothing to do with it
over-pitched on off stump, but AB is really struggling to come to terms with this pitch. He is late on the drive and can't place it past mid off either
and again, 138 kph and angling across. AB is early on the drive and inside edges it to the leg side. Not looking good. Can he guts it through this phase?
over-pitched again and this time AB drives the covers off it. High elbow, nice follow through. Everything looked good. Pity it went dead straight to cover
Wahab pushes this well outside off and it is called wide? First wide of the innings
138 kph but it comes onto AB slowly from a length as he leans into an off drive. Plays it straight to mid off. The bowling Powerplay is yielding nothing here.
over-pitched on the pads and AB works it straight to mid on for a tight single. The throw misses the stumps, but it looked like AB would have made it anyways. He runs like the wind.
well played, AB waits for it turn back into him from outside off and guides it behind square on the off for a couple
drilled. Where did that come from? AB skips out, reaches the pitch and thumps Ajmal over mid on for four. That cannoned off the meat of the bat and was four from the moment it left Ajmal's fingers
full again on middle and off, AB works it with the spin to midwicket

"Yes, no, wait, may be, can be, not at all!" AB runs half way down before turning back after Amla worked it straight to point., Makes it back in time, a direct hit from Razzaq could have been curtains though.
plays it out into the off side for no runs.
works Ajmal with the spin to midwicket, but can't find the gap
AB continues to struggle against pace. Or the lack of it. Shapes for a square drive to a ball pitched up outside off, but it comes on slowly and he misses
on leg stump line this time and AB deflects it off the hips for one to square leg
width on offer and Amla was waiting for it. Times the cut pretty well and picks a couple behind square on the off side before the sweeper comes across. He is looking at ease now

and just as I say that, Riaz makes Amla and me stupid by cutting Amla in half with a short, sharp delivery at 138 kph. It was through Amla well before he played a whip off the hips and connected with thin air
better touch this time outside off, works it with the pace behind square on the off side for a couple
over-pitched wide outside off - is Riaz trying too hard here? - Amla reaches out and places it into the covers for another single
tossed up outside leg and Amla flicks it between mid on and midwicket for one

This could be out, the third umpire called to check on a stumping appeal. Lovely bit of flight and turn from Afridi, who lands it on middle and off and snakes it past AB's uncertain prod outside off. The replay suggests not out. Wait a minute, the third umpire has said "Out"! Controversial stuff here, he seemed atleast two inches in when the bails came off. Smith in the dressing room throws his hands out and looks absolutely annoyed. Well, well! We need to look at that again, and maybe the 3rd umpire, Zameer Haider, needs to as well! The decision stays, AB is gone. Well, we have seen replays and that is a howler from the 3rd ump. AB's backfoot did come out, but he was well in when the bails came off. Even Fawad Alam, who was walking past AB as he headed back looked surprised with the call. AB just shrugged, looking clueless as he kept walking. Bizarre.
full on the middle and leg and he works it with the spin to the leg side
on off stump this time and Duminy works it to mid off this time
delicate. He goes well back in the crease and opens the face to pick a couple to third man with the deftest of dabs
stays back and punches it to mid on.
keeps Duminy on the crease with a short length ball outside off and he defends to the off side
Well, what's happened to Duminy there? Skips out of the crease and looks to wham Riaz over midwicket, but makes no contact. Into the pads and there's an optimisitinc appeal from the bowler.
this time he looks to cut from the crease, but is defeated by the slowless as it goes through to Zony.
cuts and cuts well this time, but Fawad Alam at point is quite athletic as he leaps across to his right and saves a few
whippety whip from Amla who stays in the crease and works Riaz off the pads to midwicket for one
good bouncer from Wahab, Amla spots it early and ducks under it. Through to Zony.
tossed up on off and pushes it out to cover point
reaches out and gets to the pitch this time. Plays it out to cover point again
stays back in the crease and works it with the spin to square leg this time
full and drifting down the line but Amla stays inside the line and works it off bat and pad to short fine leg

well well, Amla drives straight to mid on and runs a rather riskly single, Ajmal collects and hurls it at the stumps but misses. Afridi is miffed - "Arrey, haath mein thee yaar," yells a despairing Afridi. ("Hey, it was right in your hands," for the Urdu challenged.)
floated well wide outside off.
fuller outside off and JP comes forward to drive into the covers. Well hit, but no placement
tossed up on off and Amla comes out to reach the pitch and work it leg side
whips it off the pads towards long on for a single. Duminy doesn't like offies from round the wicket, so Ajmal may want to change the angle to him
defended to the covers this time. Full on off
tossed up and Amla takes the challenge by chipping out and lofting Ajmal over the infield. Not well timed, but high percentages in that shot since the cover field was in. It runs away for four
defended off the back foot to cover point for a single
JP stays back and works against the spin towards wide mid on for one more
another monster wide outside off from Afridi
action galore. JP skips out, reaches the pitch and works it straight back to Afridi who hurls it back in a trice. JP just about managed to get back in, though Afridi failed to hit the stumps
gets out of his crease again and picks another single to mid on
Amla takes on Ajmal again at mid on for a tight run and makes it in time. Afridi is miffed again, Ajmal is puzzled - how could that miss? Amla just sighs and looks down.
wrong 'un and Duminy had no clue what that was doing. Closes the face early on the flick and gets a leading edge into the covers
Amla stays back and works another googly with the spin, but can't find the gap
too short this time from Afridi and Amla is beside himself with joy as he waits contemplates where to put it. He chooses backward square leg and sends it there with a neat little pull shot
Short and turning into JP from outside leg, he works it square for one.
Amla stays back and works it with the spin behind square on the off for one
tossed up on off and JP drives it straight to cover
shorter and on leg stump, JP goes back to whip it square for one
Amla stays beside the line, waits for the offie to come in from outside off and opens the face to steer a single behind point. Neatly done
JP comes down the track, but still can't get to the pitch. Chooses to play it along the ground to the leg side for one
flighted outside off and JP reaches out to get to the pitch and work it with the spin to wide long on for one
generous loop on leg stump and Amla drills into the covers inside out to bring up another fifty. Everyone has struggled today, but not him. He seems to be batting on another planet.
JP goes back and guides it deftly behind square on the off side for one
Afridi drifts down the leg and concedes his third wide
on the money this time and it breaks away at a sharpish 85 kph. Amla stays in the crease and guides it into the covers for one
JP leans out and strokes it from middle and leg to long on
Speared in full on middle and leg at 90 kph. Amla reaches out and defends
full on JP's toes and he drives it down the ground for one
short outside off to Amla who calmly guides it nsquare for one behind point
drifts down the leg and another wide
length ball straightens from leg stump as JP reaches out with the front foot to pick a single to long on
check drive this time into towards long on for a single
JP leans out to a tossed up delivery and drives to the covers
good work from Hafeez as JP punches a tossed up delivery to his right. Dives away and parries it towards cover to save the single
Amla stays back and plays Afridi with the spin towards point
whoa, Afridi foxes Amla into an early drive and it goes uppishly through the covers, a few feet away from the diving fielder. Couple taken
this time, Amla reaches out and defends to the off side.
shorter this time outside off and Amla goes back to cut it through point for one
flighted outside off and JP drives it smartly between long off and cover for a couple to wide long off
and again, plays it squarer this time, closer to the cover fielder but not close enough as he dives across. Another couple taken
Hafeez keeps it tight outside off and Amla can't steer it past the point fielder
turns in from outside off and Amla works it with the spin, but straight to midwicket
finally gets the single by waiting and playing the flick very late towards square leg
JP opens the face to steer it square as it straightens from outside off. Can't beat point
JP hurries out and looks to work Hafeez from outside off. He can't make contact as it comes in and raps him outside the line. Optimistic appeal turned down
this time it is on leg stump and JP works it behind square for one
another wide and full delivery from Afridi, outside off and JP drags it from there to long on for one
short outside off and Amla punches into the covers
this time he's fuller and drifts into Amla's pads, allowing him to work him off the toes for one
good placement from JP who waits for the turn from leg stump as it went through straight and then placed it well into the covers for a couple
shorter and he stays back to guide it square for another single. JP is looking good now

languid and lethargic. Over-pitched from Afridi, Amla reaches out to take it on the full and drive through the covers. Shoaib labours across from long off and does not make much of an effort to save it. It beats his boot and reaches the fence
comes out of the crease and defends down the track

Zony has got JP with a very smart catch here. It was the regulation offie, just back of a length and JP went back to look and dab it behind square on the off. He played it very late, almost off Haider's gloves, and when he got the feather, the keeper was waiting for it. Pouches it nicely and sends JP on his way
another short ball, another cut from a left hander, another collection from Haider and an appeal, but no edge this time
goes back in the crease to punch this from off stump line down the ground for a single
the spin takes this down the leg side as Amla flicks it behind square for a single to the deep
spears this into Miller's pads as he tries to nurdle it to the leg side
Afridi gets Amla to spoon uppishly again, and it lands just short of a diving Asad Shafiq at cover again. Single is taken, Afridi is not happy, "Ball ko pakad lo yaar!", he yells!
whangs this short outside off and Miller looks to cut and misses
fuller this off stump and he Miller plays it into the cover for one. Poor throw, nearly concedes a second. Afridi is livid!
hurries Amla into a shot with one that curls in fast and breaks away. Good stuff from Afridi
similar ball but Amla is ready this time and plays it out into the covers for one
finishes with a teasing slider that beats Miller's forward prod, not by much, and finishes in Zony Haider's anticipating gloves
back of a length and turning in from outside off, Amla waits back and steers square for one
tossed up on off and Miller drives it into the covers. Good placement there and picks a couple

nice work all-round. Miller rocks back to one that was marginally short and unfurls a lovely little cut that was set to beat the sweeper. But Younis Khan had other ideas, running across to his right and diving to pull it in
quicker one, Miller is late on the cut this time and it is through him in a flash

Hafeez has owned Miller here with another quicker one. Miller is miffed with himself for playing back, despite having been beaten by the quicker one last time around. This was back of a length on leg stump and hurried straight on from a length towards leg stump, Miller was late on the chop and it sneaked through to hit the timber. Miller lets out a yell of agony, Pakistan on top.
regulation offie back of a length outside off and Albie feels out meekly and plays it into the covers
speared into middle and leg, Amla goes back and whips another single through midwicket. Men may come and men may go, Amla rolls on serenely
flighted on middle and off, Albie drives against the spin to wide mid off
stays back this time and works Afridi with the spin for a single to midwicket
flighted on Amla's off stump and he is drawn into the cover drive again, but keeps it along the ground this time. Straight to the fielder in the circle
plays around the pads this time and nurdles Afridi against the spin to midwicket for one
short outside off and Albie chops it through point for one
comes off slowly from the pitch as Akhtar lands it on a length outside off. Albie is early on the backfoot punch and it runs off the inside edge to the bowler
again, plays early as this comes on from leg stump line and it raps him on the pads. Was probably headed down the leg
good lengths and lines from Akhtar who gives him no room to cut. Albie steers it straight to Alam at point,
very short and very wide, very hardly cut, but again, straight to Alam.
pushes him back with a back of a length delivery at 138 kph and Morkel looks to punch off the back foot. Absolutely no timing as it goes into the covers
bullies Albie with another short lifter outside off that he meekly defends to the off side
tossed up on off and Amla chips it with the spin to long on
on a length on off stump again and Morkel plays in circumspect style to the covers
this is on the pads and Albie plays all around it by closing the face early
on a length again around off and Albie drives it back to the bowler
full on the off stump and Albie picks a single at long last, to long off
Amla stays back and clips it with the spin behind square on the on side for one more
Shoaib produces another piece of dynamite that rears up from a length and raps a leaping Amla on the knuckles. The Monk is a little unsettled, but he regains compssure and smiles. Good stuff
beaten outside off with another fastish lifter! Amla was looking to steer it through point, but missed. Not by much
another bouncer, Amla is pushed back and he rides the bounce to defend to the off side
well played, another bouncer but this time Amla got into position early and controlled a pull shot along the gorund to long leg for one
Albie comes half forward reluctantly to a length ball angling across from middle and off. Played off the inside half back to the bowler
full on off and Albie punches this into the covers. More assured this time, but still can't get the gap
comes in from outside off and Amla opens the face to steer it behind square
straightens from middle and off and Albie defends
on the pads this time and Albie manages to beat the diving Shafiq at midwicket for a single
sharp spin back into Amla who was looking to cut, but corrected the shot and defended at the last moment
gets outside off and sweeps with the spin behind square. Fumble from Farhat at short fine leg allows one
flighted on off stump and Albie dourly defends back to the bowler
lands on a length at middle and leg and Amla plays it softly to midwicket for a tight single. Another shy, another miss this time from Shafiq. He may have made it anyway.
bangs it in short of a length and Albie stays back to defend into the off side
short and wide outside off and Albie latches well with a cut shot. That relieves some of the pressure, four through point. Well hit by Albie.
pushes him back with a better line this time, closer to the stumps. Albie again looks to cut, but can't get it away this time
slower dleivery at 115 kph drifts onto leg stump and Albie works it to midwicket for one. He did well to pick the change in pace there
opens the face and looks to run one square, but can't beat point
tossed up on off and Albie reaches out with more assurance  and plays it into the covers
Amla shuffles across well outside off and managed to lap sweep behind square for one. That's possibly as wide outside off stump as the sweep can be humanly played to
Albie plays down to long on for one
Amla stays in the crease and works it with the spin to midwicket for another one
Albie stays back and flicks Hafeez against the spin to the leg side
loud and imploring appeal from Haider as the ball lands outside leg and raps Morkel on the pads a good two feet outside the crease. No run taken. And the appeal it not even acknowledged
full on off and Amla drives into the covers without much timing
no room at all from Riaz, on off stump, but Amla still manages to open the face and steer it to third man for one
one for the over. Good bouncer, aimed at the rib cage and Albie does the smart thing by ducking under it
another bouncer - 141.3 kph - but wider outside off as Albie goes for a swat pull. He makes no contact and Haider has a smug smile as he collects

Another run out opportunity missed. Pakistan have fielded wrell today, without hitting the stumps ever. Albie squirts this straight to Hafeez and hustles out. Amla is not so sure and both batsmen stutter for a moment, giving Hafeez enough time to line up the timber. He shies at the bowler's end. And misses. With Albie a good couple of yards out of the picture.
Amla looks to guide another one on the off stump towards third man but can't get the single this time
pushes Albie back with a shortish skidder and Albie poles it out to the covers for one
drifts onto Amla's pads and he works it square for one
whoa, was that a chance? Wrong 'un tossed up on middle and off, Albie worked it back straight, a couple of feet away from Afridi on his follow through. Hmm

Shafiq drops a sharp chance! For the nth time today, Afridi lures Amla into an early cover drive, this time Amla went hard at it and tried to loft over the infield. But he could not get the height he wanted and it was Shafiq's zone as he leapt in the covers. But he could not hold on
shorter and Amla goes back to play it calmly to the off side
on the stumps, turning away from leg and Amla plays watchfully into midwicket for one
Amla comes across, gets inside the line and works him with the spin to square leg for one
short outside off and Albie stays back to drive it towards long off for one
delicate. Back of a length outside off and Amla waits to guide it behind square. The later he played it, the further away it took it from the sweeper. And that allowed him the second run
this one is straighter and Amla works it with the spin to midwicket, this is very smart batting
tossed up on leg and middle, Albie reaches out to defend

Albie taps it to the off side and yells at Amla to come across. Ajmal runs across to his right, collects and gets into position to throw, but fails to get a good footing and does not release the ball. Might have been close. Pakistan's fielding is dipping a little here.
over-pitched on off and middle and Morkel drives crisply along the ground to the right of Afridi for a couple before long off cleans up
full again, on leg stump and Morkel drives it straight back at Afridi
outside off on this occasion and Albie eases it into the covers for a single
97 kph and hurries into Amla who stays in the crease and works it with the angle behind square for one

another one bites the dust. Afridi has the look of a man who has decieved a batsman several times with the googly, before finally getting him with one - smug and satisfied. Albie has had enough of poking around and dances out this time. Afridi sees him, holds it back and produces a googly. Albie looks to ping midwicket, the ball turns away and takes the top edge and balloons to the right of long off. Hafeez runs across and takes a good catch.
Amla retains strike with another single, flicking a full ball on leg stump towards deep midwicket
top spinner from Ajmal, Amla sees it late and adjusts well to deflect off the outside half towards point for one
another top spinner, but short enough for Botha to spot and play it down to mid off
gives it more air outside off and Botha works it down the ground for one
Amla stays in the crease, waits for it to turn across him and then works it behind square for one
fastish top spinner at 94 kph and Botha does well to keep it out. That was homing in on his pads in front of leg stump
another quicker one, Botha stays back and works it towards midwicket
Amla moves across to off stump and gets inside the line to work it from the stumps to midwicket for one
works it with the spin to the leg side for another single
played out into the covers for a single
Botha reaches out and looks to drive across the line. He is beaten by the flight and gets a bit if leading edge towards long off
Amla nudges it off the pads to midwicket, but can't find the gap
this time he picks a single to retain strike, by steering it through square on the off side
top shot. Amla spotted the fast top spinner early, gave himself room and dabbed it fine towards third man for a couple.
this one turned back in and Amla punched against the spin into the covers
more air, on the middle and leg line and Amla works it off the pads to midwicket
another couple, he is working the angles well here. Amla stays in the crease and uses the wrists to take that cover drive square and keep it away from deep point
sharp offie this time, Amla waits for the spin and then adjusts after reading it off the pitch to defend to the off side

exquisite batting on a tough pitch. Ajmal is mixing it up, Amla is keeping it simple. Another top spinner, Amla knew it was coming, made room outside off and whiplashed the cut through backward point, and it scurried across the turf
back of a length and tight on the stumps, Botha stays back and defends down the pitch
drifts on the pads at 138 kph and Botha glances it square. Amla has the energey to make it back easily for the second
good lines from Riaz, on off stump at 138 kph and Botha can't do much with it. Defend it into the covers
slower ball, 115 kph on that off cutter. Botha spots the change in pace and the deviation and tries to steer it late. But he can't get it past point

banged in at 133 kph, Botha was not expecting a bouncer, and adjusted well to play one of the clumsiest pull shots, but managed to keep it down. His body was tilted at an angle of 60 degrees with the horizontal when he played it

another short ball, another pull shot - this time, it is played the way it is meant to be - rolling the wrists and keeping it down towards fine leg. There is cover though, so he still waits for the 100. One away now.

Sixth ODI ton of the career. Fifth this year. Amla puts his arms up and acknowledges some well deserved cheers. Short and just outside off, Amla plays a shot he has played well all-day - the steer to third man despite not having the room. He runs across. Shoaib shakes his hand. Well played!
on a length on Botha's off stump and he defends it to the off side
141 kph, pacy lifter outside off and Botha was aeons late on the cut shot. He got a thick edge and it flew away fine for four. Third man did not have a chance
slow off cutter now and Botha's timing goes awry as he looks to punch off the back foot
another sharp bouncer at 138 kph and Botha is late on the pull. He manages to pick a single to the on side of the pitch

another slow off cutter and Shoaib almostdoes Amla in. He is early on the cut as it cuts back in at 118 kph and takes the inside edge. The French cut misses the furniture though and they take a single
full and fast outside off and Amla can't quite squeeze it square. Through to the keeper
hint of reverse as it swerves away from leg and middle at 139 kph. Amla looks to cover drive and the deviation results in it flying square towards deep point
lovely hit from Botha as Wahab lands this on the pads  and Botha works it with oriental charm through midwicket. They hustle across for three
misfield and four. Another full ball curving away from Amla and he crunches out a cover drive past Razzaq at cover who falls over the ball. Good hit
slowe ball, short and spinning across as Botha opens the face and runs it to point. Amla hurries across and SA have 200
back of a length again and angling across, deftly worked sqaure for one more. SA have stolen 10 from the over. Good start to the PP

ooh, nastly little bouncer, great exhibition for fast bowling and a good advertisement for the maker of Botha's helmet. He was quite late on the pull and it thudded into the peak of the helmet and his head yanked back on impact. Shoaib apologises, Botha regains control and then looks at the helmet. He takes a sip of water and is ready to play.

the damage was done last ball, the reward is reaped this time. Shoaib has been exceptional today in working batsmen out - with fast lifters followed by slower balls - and with nasty bouncers followed by scorching yorkers like this one. Botha was clearly still thinking about the bouncer and was late in coming down on that as it snaked through from off stump line and made a mess of the stumps. Well bowled Shoaib!
short and aimed at Morne's body as he is stuck on the crease and looks to work it round the corner. Can't get bat on it
more pace, 142 kph and hurtling across on and around off stump. Morne edges it onto his thigh and is thankful to take a single to cover.
back of a length on off stump and Amla stays in the crease to calmly pick a single behind square. He's not risking anything against Shoaib.

another throw, another miss. By the law of averages, Pakistan should be hitting the stumps a few times, around now. Shoaib follows Morne as he stays outside leg stump and it goes off the body into the covers. They take off for another impossible single, but the throw misses again
Wahab reverses another one into Morne's pads from off stump and he can't time the drive to the off side.
prodigious late movement here, from a foot outside off it swerves back menacingly at 138 kph as Morne looks to squeeze into the off side. Play and a miss
this time he starts the movement from middle and off, and Morne manages to get it away off the inside edge towards midwicket. Amla has strike, what can he do now.

Mowed! Amla is looking to turn on the heat now and Wahab obliges with a half tracker, with mid on and midwicket inside the circle. Amla saw it early and ensured he pulled early to get it through that gap rather than square. Executed to perfection
and now a wide well outside off
over-pitched outside off as it curls away and Amla gets it away off the bottom half of the bat towards deep cover for one
see you later. Bouncer at 138 kph around off stump and Morne was so late on the pull, it took the top edge and ballooned up towards mid off. Fawad Alam completes the catch and Morne has to go.
full toss on Amla's pads and he works it straight to midwicket and takes off for a single. The fielder throws at the stumps. You know what happened next. Yes, he missed.

Searing yorker, Theron stumbles as he looks to squeeze it to midwicket and they take off for another single. There's another shy at the stumps and this time he hits! Third umpire called to adjudicate. "Come on, third umpire!," says Ramiz. Not out is the call.
no-ball, over Shoaib oversteps with the slower ball and the next one is a free hit
Shoaib sees Amla backing away and follows him like a guided missile. Amla can't do much and drives it with all his might down to long on
The Dubai Open tennis tournament begins early as Theron produces the cross court down the court for a single to mid on. Good bouncer aimed at the body
Shoaib's lost the plot late in the spell. Full toss, curls away down the leg and through to the boundary. He is LIVID with himself
short ball at 135 kph on off stump and Amla can't time the cross batted shot down the ground. Shoaib fields and it is a dot ball
another late tailing low full toss and Amla punches it down to long on for one. Shoaib finishes a wonderful spell, despite a poor last over, and Afridi pats him on the back

Run out chance, third umpire called for again. Full and wide outside off and Amla throws everything at it. Thick edge hurries down to Ajmal at third man as Amla looks to come back for a tight second. The throw is not great and Amla makes his ground before Zulqarnain can whip the bails off.
keeps it full and wide outside off, smart move as Amla goes for the flay and misses
another one full and swinging away from Amla, who slices and dices as he throws his bat at it. The swing forces it to hit the bottom half of the bat and it balloons up over the covers for one
that late reverse again and Rusty gets a healthy outside edge that sends it hurtling to third man, Ajmal does immensely well to run across and stop that inside the ropes
full, fast and swinging away again, and Theron goes for the almightly heave over the covers and misses. Huge appeal for caught behind, turnmed down by Aleem Dar. Rightly

ends with a run out, and no, not a direct hit! Full and wide again outside off as Theron square drives. The sweeper runs across and fires in the throw to Haider before Rusty could come back for the second. Bails are off and there is no need for the 3rd ump to give that out.

inn2.comm: begins with a shortish ball on the hips and Farhat tries to work it leg side, but can't get it away
step, 141 kph and that takes off from back of a length. Farhat gets under it as it whizzes past
good stuff from Morne, gets that to angle across from back of a length and it hurries through at good height after landing. Farhat yanks the bat away as it goes through to AB
leg-stump line this time and Farhat works it off the hips for a single behind square leg
this goes down into the right-hander's pads and Hafeez lets it go off the pads towards fine leg for a couple of extras
short and good carry through again at 139 kph, Hafeez nicely rides the bounce and steers to point
angles in from outside off and Farhat prods inside the line as it carries through.
fuller on off and this time Farhat is more forthright as he reaches out and defends into the covers

Huge appeal, turned down by Rob Tucker. Comes in from wide of the crease and angles into Farhat's toes on leg stump. Hit him in front of the stumps, but wouldit  have been angling down? Replays say it would have hit leg.
outside off, back of a length and defended with the full face down the track
124 kph and full on the pads, Farhat is struggling with the lack of pace as he plays it off the inside half to midwicket
very full and straight again, Farhat times the straight drive well, but can't get it past the bowler
pushes Hafeez back with a shortish delivery on off stump and angling in. Played out to the leg side
outside off, and on that un-drivable length again. Hafeez stays back and punches it into the covers
143 kph and keeps it back of a length again. Hafeez forces it off the backfoot back to the bowler
slightly fuller, but not drivable yet. Hafeez plays it out to the covers again. He wants to drive, you can see, but Morne has his driving license siezed for now.
even shorter and an edgy Hafeez tries to pull. In no poisition for that shot as it hurries into him before he can ready for it. The hand comes off the bat and it pops up on the leg side.
this time he was waiting for it. Well played by Hafeez, uses the wrists to keep the pull down and get it away square for three
angled across the right hander who leans out and shoulders arms
fuller on off stump and Hafeez check drives it straight down the ground for a single before mid on came across
and Tsotsobe bowls a delivery that would keep that fielder interested. Farhat stays back and fends unconvincingly at a short ball, but gets it behind square
crisp drive, full of intent from Hafeez who leans into it and times the on-drive well, but can't get it past mid-off
and again, carbon copy of the previous ball, but he managed to get it a little straighter. Still can't beat the fielder
holds it back a touch, 122 kph as Hafeez reaches out to drive and adjusts to push it out to short cover
on middle and leg at 140 kph and it is played straight to mid on
finally Morne gives Farhat something to drive and he licks his lips as he leans in belatedly and sends it square. Did not hit it hard enough for 4, more of a check drive and he picks a couple
normal service resumes, short and angling across the left-hander at good height. He lets it go
bouncer takes off at 139 kph. That was really short and close to being wided. He gets away with it though.
jags this in with the angle from outside off and Farhat looks to tap it into the covers for one. The fielder comes in quickly to deny the run
hits the deck again, and gets a hint of away movement. Farhat plays it off the outside half and the thick edge goes behind point for a single
nicely done. Slower ball at 125 kph, Farhat spotted it and played it very softly towards mid-on for an easy single
Hafeez reaches out and defends outside off as Tsotsobe gets one to angle across him from leg stump

gone. Botha at short cover is in business as Hafeez walks into a neatly laid snare. It was again slowish from Tsotsobe, it was landed in Hafeez's half, inviting him to drive through the covers. It came on slowly and he ended up spooning it in the air and Botha took a sharp catch to send him back.
gentle off cutter angling away from Younis who covers the deviation and defends off the front foot into the covers
pushes him back with a sharper delivery, 132 kph this time, and Younis rides the bounce to defend down the track
the sucker ball again, full and wide outside off at 126 kph. Younis was drawn into the cover drive, but ensured he played it to the left of short cover. Uppish, but safe.
Morne delivers another peach. Angling in from round the wicket, it lands back of a length and then nips away from a befuddled Farhat who fishes inside the line
this one goes on straight and Farhat gets something on it as he tries to play off the hips
back of a length and coming into Younis who looks for the good old tip and run to the off side. Can't get it away from the cordon though
short again and Younis stays back to steer it, but he doesn't have any room to work with. Straight to point.
pushes Younis back with another well directed short ball and he defends it ti the off side as he hops back

Younis is gone and South Africa are on top here thanks to some high quality seam and pace bowling. Morne has been troubling Younis with that length and lands another one on the corridor. Younis decides late to come forward, and tries to steer it as it rises disconcertingly outside off. Outside edge taken and lands safely in the slips.
another one short of good length and he defends safely to the off side
full slower ball at 119 kph drifts into the pads and Farhat works it off the toes for one
Shafiq gets behind the line and defends down the track to the off side
wider outside off and he shoulders arms to let it go through to AB
another lifter outside off and Shafiq does not want anything to do with it as it goes through
ooh, lands it fuller, but not full enough to drive and Shafiq nearly falls to the bait as he pushes out without conviction. Misses the outside edge though

confident appeal from Morne as Farhat shuffles across and plays all around a short ball coming into him. Was it the height? Was it the angle? It hit in front of middle and leg and Aleem Dar was not at all interested in it
works this off the pads, but can't time it too well or place it past midwicket
fuller at over 140 kph and draws Farhat out. He leans across gingerly and check drives into the covers
heeps him honest with another back of length delivery that kicks up. Farhat plays it defensively into the off side after motioning down the track
lifter outside off whistles across at 139 kph and Farhat is atleast a day late on the cut shot. It was in AB's gloves when he completed his bat swish. At thin air.

not this time, Farhat is ready for the length this time, it helped that it did not lift too much from back of a length, and he unfurled a pleasing square cut for four. Not much room to work with, but he did well to time it and find the gap
Lonwao Tso-slow-be delivers another slower delivery, off cutter landed full at 119 kph and Shafiq spotted it late and defended
shorter and faster as it angles across Shafiq who unfurls a nice square drive past point. Ingram tags it all the way and pulls it in, nicely done.
shorter outside off and good carry again from a length as Farhat ducks under it.
back of a length outside off and Farhat works it straight to cover. Thinks of a non-existent single and then goes back in
this angles into the body and Farhat got inside the line to work it off the hips for a single towards sqaure leg
looks to angle it across from a length and Shafiq leans across to push it to wide mid on
bangs it in short of a length and Shafiq stays in the crease to ride the bounce and steer it to the off side
comes in from outside off as Shafiq stays back and looks to work it with the angle towards square leg
Yes, no situation as Shafiq leans out to push a quick single to midwicket. The throw went to the striker's end, but Shafiq seemed to be the man who was struggling at the other end
over-pitched on the pads but Farhat can't capitalise as he clips it off the toes straight to mid on
slower ball, 104.5 kph and full on middle and off, Farhat sees it and flicks across the line to send it to square leg for another single
and he finishes with a bouncer outside off, Shafiq seemed all too eager to duck under it and did just that

as Bill Lawry would say, it is all happening here in Dubai. Slower ball on middle and leg, Farhat was early on the flick and nearly spooned it back to Tsotsobe. Shafiq then thought of a single and backed up too far before returning. And the stumps were middes from mid on.
stays back and works it off the pads towards square leg for no run
AB does a bit of goal-keeping as it clips Farhat's pads and seems headed for the fine leg fence. Great work
slower ball at 111 kph and Farhat concentrates on covering the line and defending with the fulo face
a bit of width outside off and Farhat stays in the crease to open the face and run it to third man
on a length on Shafiq's pads and he flicks it without intent to midwicket. Pakistan are going nowhere.
tight line, just outside off and Farhat looks to cut. The lack of room does his timing no favours and it goes straight to point
Kallis rolls his fingers across an off cutter and sends it in at 117 kph. Farhat completed the backlift early and waited, and then tried to play the cut... And missed.
short ball and Farhat ducks under it. Called wide for height
another lovely off cutter and Farhat had no clue as he looked for the cover drive and played a few inches inside the line.
this one is on leg and middle and Farhat whips it straight to midwicket. The placement and timing are conspicuous by the absence., The crowd is getting restless here
full and on the toes, worked off the legs straight to midwicket. The lack of timing made a single possible
slower ball, 114 kph and short as it angles into Shafiq who works it with the wrists behind square for one
back of a length outside off and coming into Shafiq who plays defensively to the leg side
similar ball, coming into Shafiq who shapes for the flick too early and misses it
this time the angle takes it into Shafliq's pads and he works it square for a single
Theron offers rare width and Farhat can't time the square cut at all. It goes well in front of square, suggesting how slow the wicket it. Single to sweeper cover
comes in with the angle and Shafiq reaches out to work it across the line., Can't get it away for runs

slower ball and a close shave for Shafiq who nearly runs himself out. He works the off cutter with the turn towards Miller at square leg and takes off. There was no run there and he turned back late and looked to dive in. Miller's throw missed, but if it had hit...
over-pitched off cutter and Farhat drives without timing to mid off and takes a single. Wanted: Boundaries.
length ball, Shafiq shows the full face and punches to mid on.
short and angling into his body this time and Shafiq manages to pull it behind square for one. A little finer and he may have got four
slow off cutter again at 110 kph and Farhat opens the face to pick a single behind point
over-pitched on the pads and Shafiq clips it square for another single.
what does Farhat have to do to time a ball? Again over-pitched by Kallis on the pads and he flicks wide of midwicket. No timing at all and they manage to pick a couple
Boundary! Oxygen for Pakistan! Rusty sends one down the leg and Shafiq gets inside the line to glance it very fine for four to fine leg
short ball angling in from outside off and he nudges it square for another single
slow off cutter moving across from middle and off, Farhat opens the face and guides it straight to point
hint of room outside off and he crunches it square, to the right of point for one
Rusty keeps it short and aims at Shafiq's body. He drops it to the leg side for one.
another slower ball and another piece of poor timing from Farhat who looks to work it leg side and gets it meekly back to the bowler
looped up on off stump and Shafiq comes forward to work it with the spin to the leg side
wider outside off and Shafiq leans out to play it back to the bowler
holds this back a touch but Shafiq is again forward looking to play down the track

leaves Shafiq groping with a lovely piece of off spin. That was looped on off stump and it turned back with a whirr as Shafiq airily tried to work it leg side without closing the bat-pad gap. It went through off the pad and somehow missed the stumps
Farhat works it off the back foot against the spin towards midwicket

Shafiq leads a charmed life out there as Botha flummoxes him once again. He chips out, fails to reach the pitch and watches helplessly as it lands, holds its line to beat his outside edge and proceed through towards AB de Villiers, who fluffs an easy stumping. He closed the gloves too early there
Farhat tries to muscle a length ball through midwicket with a straight bat, but manages only a couple. Not enough bicep on that.

Miller misses the stumps again and Shafiq survives. Farhat defends to cover and takes off, Shafiq was struggling at the striker's end as Miller swooped on it and threw in one lovely motion. But he missed and they took an overthrow
opens the face and looks to steer one outside off. Goes straight to point
back of a length on leg stump and Farhat works it straight down the ground for one
back of a length outside off and defended to the off side
this one is on the stumps and Shafiq looks to nurdle round the corner, but he can't quite get it away
generously tossed up on the pads and flicked square for one
Shafiq pushes out again to reach the pitch and woirk Botha with the spin to the leg side
and again, closes the face and sends it towards midwicket
doosra this time and Shafiq has no clue what is coming. AB neither, both of them are beaten by Botha's brilliance
gets bat on ball this time and picks a single ti midwicket
theatrical appeal from Botha as Farhat gets pad on one sliding well down and picks a couple. Umpire Dar looks almost embarrassed as he signals leg byes.

Shafiq plays the very epitome of the nothing shot. Short outside off and he tries to pull it or something down the ground. Goes off the top edge and timed so badly that it did not carry to any of the off side fielders inside the circle
Farhat reaches the pitch of a pitched up delivery and guides to covers
shorter and angling across. Farhat runs it off the face towards third man for one
tight line, coming into Shafiq from back of a length on off stump and he drops it to midwicket for one
another slow off cutter and another mistimed guide from Farhat as he looks to run it off the face. Straight to short third man
slow and short outside off at 113 kph and Farhat cuts without timing to point
top spinner outside off and Shafiq is again eager to play it to the leg side. Ends up defending to the off side
again, reaches out a mile to work Botha with the spin to midwicket
full on off and driven back to the bowler
finally, Botha lads one well outside off and forces Shafiq, against his nature, to go through the off side with a cut
grip and turn, it comes in with the angle and breaks away as Farhat poked without conviction

Tsotsobe hits the stumps and it has gone upstairs. Farhat opens the face and runs it straight to point for a single, but Shafiq made it just in time as the bails came off. Will the 3rd ump get this right? Yes he does - not out it is.
length ball on off and Farhat looks to hoick over the covers. It goes off the bottom half of the bat to mid off
shorter and wide outside off, Farhat cuts it to the right of point who does well to dive and save runs
Shafiq drops a short of length ball to the off side for a quick single
Farhat chips out of the crease and Theron sees him and drops it short and wide, forcing him to reach out and steer through the covers
slightly short and Shafiq throws everything behind a pull shot. Straight to sweeper on the leg side
Farhat guides another one to Botha at point and takes a single
flighted on off stump and Farhat leans out to work him against the spin to midwicket
holds it back, slow through the air and it breaks into Shafiq who plays watchfully
now Shafiq plays a ball he should have been looking to worlk leg side, to the off side. Backs away and cuts from leg stump line into the covers.
shot of the innings. Shafiq stays beside the line as Botha drops one short and just outside off. Shafiq waits for it to come back in and then dabs it very late to the third man boundary
back on the stumps and Shafiq looks to work it off the pads to the leg side

whoa, what happened there? Shafiq looks to turn Botha to the leg side, and it takes something and balloons up between AB and short fine leg, both of whom leave it for the other. Was there an edge? Replays suggest it went straight off the pad.
Farhat gets the most well-timed inside edge I have ever seen as he looks to flick JP to midwicket and gets a thick edge that flies away to the right of a diving cover fielder for one
tossed up on off and played back to the bowler
straightens from middle and leg and Shafiq nurdles it round the corner for one
slightly short and he looks to cut. Mistimed behind point for one
generous full toss outside off and generously driven straight to long on for one
Farhat stays beside the line and looks to dab a ball that was turning away from him after landing on off stump. Cant get it past point
tossed up on off and Shafiq eases it with the spin towards square leg for one
look for the guide square on the off side again, but can't beat point
decieved by the drift as it comes in and lands on leg stump. Runs away off the inside edge towards wide long on

Short and wide, and for the second time in two overs, Shafiq takes Botha for four through the off side. This was asking to be hit and Shafiq did well to play it well in front of square. Albie ran across from third man and seemed to have it covered, but could not stop it
full on the pads and flicked to midwicket for one
Farhat pulls out the sweep and controls it well down to deep backward square leg. Only one
short and wide outside off and Farhat cuts cautiously for a single to the sweeper
full on middle and off, Shafiq works it with the spin square for one
very full on leg stump and Farhat tries to work it leg side but can't get it away
expansive cover drive this time, but can't get it past cover
leading edge this time as he closes the face early and nearly pops it back to JP
and that cover drive again, in the air and just past a full-length dive from the cover fielder. High risk for a single
Farhat hoicks from off and middle across the line. Slog sweep of sorts, in front of square for a couple to deep midwicket
short and wider outside off, Farhat cuts it away square for another single
leans out and works it from outside off to JP at midwicket  who denies the single with some sharp work
short ball, extra bounce and a puff of dust as it comes off and Shafiq cuts it through the off side as it gets big on him
Farhat looks to open the face and steer through the off side, but can't time it
skips out and looks to loft, but can't get the elevation and plays it out to deep extra cover for a couple
Shafiq again reaches out to work Botha with the spin to the leg side
gets it away behind square for a quick single this time
misses the sweep as it slips down the leg and it is called wide
full and on the pads, Farhat misses the flick and there is a stifled lbw appeal
jumps out again, gets to the pitch and drives along the ground to wide long off
driven to cover for a single

Rusty sends in a cannon throw from deep backward square leg and Farhat must be on his way. Unless the 3rd umpire presses the wrong button. Worked off the pads towards the deep and he thought of coming back for a second since it did not hurry across the turf. Theron, on the other hand, was hurrying and sent in a superb throw. AB had little to do, collecting it besides the stumps and breaking them in a jiffy with Farhat well short
full on off and worked with the spin to wide long on. Single. Afridi to face.
short and wide outside off as Afridi tries to cut. And misses. AB misses too.

Right, the record is Afridi's now. He has gone past Sanath as the highest six-hitter of alltime across all formats. Jumps out, gets to the pitch and creams Botha against the spin and against conventional wisdom over the covers. Fasten those seatbelts folks.
looks to late cut and gets a bottom edge that goes nowhere
works it with the spin towards midwicket for a single.
Shafiq nurdles another single round the corner for a single
back of a length outside off and Shafiq opens the face to deflect it to point.
this time he gets it away behind square for a single and gives Afridi the strike

And gone. Afridi implodes. He lasted just long enough to make the record. Gets a short ball just outside off and goes for a cut. He probably should have been leaving that along. Thin edge through to AB who holds on. SA have a huge wicket here. A few minutes of Afridi could have sealed this match. Morne roars.
full on off and he plays softly into the covers. Can't get it away past the cover fielder
bouncer, very wide and short and called a wide too
Alam goes back and drives into the covers to get off the mark
rippa! Fawad shuffles across and looks to defend a delivery that booms past him and deviates away a touch, just enough to beat the outside edge
Shafiq leans out and works with the spin to square leg for one more
tossed up on off and driven out to long off for a single
short and menacing bounce as it hurries through, past Shafiq's attempted cut
reaches out to a fuller delivery and works it round the corner
again, works him with the spin to the leg side but not for runs
full on off stump and driven back to the bowler
flighted on off and Fawad drives through the covers for one
Shafiq reaches out to reach the pitch and on-drive for one more
tossed up outside off and Fawad inside edge a drive towards mid on
full on middle and leg and worked back to the bowler
opens the face to guide the cover drive into the gap and pick a single
Shafiq looks to play the reverse sweep and misses outside off. AB does too. Hmm.
right through Alam who reaches out and drives airily at a top spinner that AB actually collects.
skips out and drives back to the bowler does Alam
rocks back , waits for the spin and cuts late and behind square on the offside. Picks two before the sweeper comes across
tossed up on middle and off, he opens the face and runs it towards point for a quick single
tossed up on middle and off and Shafiq reaches out to work him square again
Fawad leans out and looks to steer it square, but can't middle the shot
short and wide and Shafiq misses the cut. Will think he's missed a gift there
over-pitched on off and he pulls out an expansive extra cover drive. He can't run back for two as he ambles across gingerly on cramped legs

and that's all we will be seeing from Shafiq tonight. Fawad taps it softly into the covers and they take off for a quick single. Miller throws down the stumps quickly and Aleem Dar does not even ask for the 3rd umpire. Shafiq has a wistful word with Fawad before heading back

another tight run and Alam needs to dive in full length to make his ground. It was tapped into the covers by Razzaq and they try another iffy single. Ingram at cover swoops down on it and dives firward as he under-arms into the stumps, as does Fawad. He makes it by a few inches
flighted on off and Fawad drives back to the right of JP who dives across and saves it
opens the face and uses the wrists to send this square rather than straight. Single into the covers
looped up on off and Fawad digs it out back to the bowler
what was that? Botha holds it back, but Fawad was committed to the sweep even though he could not get to the pitch. He ended up reaching out with bat in one hand and swiping it square
Razzaq stays in the crease and taps it with the spin towards square leg for one
regulation offie, breaks away from off stumo and Fawad defends to the off side
full toss on the pads and Fawad places it towards deep midwicket and wants two. Razzaq prefers to keep strike
flighted outside off and turning back into Razzaq who covers the spin and defends to the off side
full and angling in, Fawad does well to place the on-drive to the left of midwicket for a couple. Not too well timed though
short ball angling into him and Fawad stays back to block it into the covers for another single
lets one go outside off through to AB. Will the next one be a bouncer? Or a yorker?
effort ball, banged in at 135 kph and good carry through to AB as Razzaq lets it go again
hurries him again with a short ball angling into him and Razzaq fends to the leg side for one
a foot of room outside off and Fawad tries to carve it through point. The fielder half stops it and keeps him down to one
another one back of a length outside off and Fawad steers it through the covers for one
short outside off and Razzaq leans back to tap it into the covers for another quick single
whacked. Short ball lifting outside off and Fawad gives it his all, but still can't elude deep point with the cut
Bham! Kallis gives Razzaq a half-tracker into his body and at Kallis' pace Razzaq is not concerned by the short ball. Slams it over the infield with the horizontal bat wide of long on for four
another short ball, sharper this time and onto Razzaq before he expected. It balloons up towards fine leg for a single
Fawad is beaten outside off as he tries to steer one just wide of the stumps and misses
pushes Razzaq back with a short delivery and he quietly defends into the covers with soft hands to turn the strike
length ball on off stump and Fawad check drives it to mid off
and again, this time he decides to take on Tsotsobe's arm for a quick single and gets there in time with some big strides. Tsotsobe misses
fuller and slower off cutter, Razzaq spots the change in pace and defends to the covers
lifter outside off and Razzaq lets it go. He is clearly choosing his battles here.
another short one angling into Razzaq who rises on his toes and defends to the leg side
length ball on the pads and Fawad works it straight to midwicket. Too many dots of late
Kallis offers a bit of width and Fawad goes back to cut square. Can't get it past point.
fuller on off and this time Fawad opens the face to guide it into the covers for a single
pushes Razzaq back, they are conscious not to let him drive, and he defends into the covers
very short and Razzaq does well to connect with an improvised pull as it was lifting around head height. Single to deep midwicket
speared in from wide of the crease into the leg stump and Fawad drives towards mid off for one
the lack of pace is not helping - 128 kph - as it angles into Fawad who inside edges it towards midwicket
back of a length and Fawad rocks back to labour a cut shot. Can't time it at all, and it goes to cover
three dots on the trot as he looks to steer to the covers to steal a single. Goes too fast to the fielder
this one is on his pads and he clips it square for a single. Fawad is struggling for timing too.
opens the face to guide a delivery outside off to third man for one
mis-timed again. Back of a length outside off and Fawad tries hard to get some fluency into his attempted square cut. It doesn't go anywhere
short and coming into Razzaq who backs away in an attempt to improvise. Cuts it away fine, but there is cover at third man
Fawad jumps out, Kallis holds it back, Fawad groans as he realises he still can't drive and looks to carve through the off side. No timing as it dribbles away for no runs

nearly foxes him with a slow off cutter at 113 kph. Fawad was into the shot even before the ball had landed back of a length. It gripped and deviated away, and Fawad yanked his bat away late. It popped up short of point coming in
gets some meat behind the cut and sends it for a single behind point

Kallis has got the big prize and this game is now South Africa's to lose. This is not Razzaq's kind of pitch and South Africa have done well to deny him anything drivable. Like this ball which was very short and gave him no room to cut or pull either. He ended up playing a fore-handed smash down the ground, as the pressure was building up at the other end. Faint feather through to AB who holds on to another important catch
back of a length just outside off and Haider steers it straight to point
Fawad continues to struggle as he labours a length ball down the ground for one
this comes on slowly as Haider shapes to flick and he plays it uppishly towards midwicket
very short and wide and Haider reluctantly upper cuts it over the infield for a single to deep point
good lengths from Tsotsobe, Fawad stays beside the line and drives through the covers for a single
good bouncer, follows Haider after landing on off stump and he goes back and stand tall to steer it to third man for one
angles into Fawad's body and he gets some pad on it for a leg bye towards square leg. Pakistan's innings is stuttering along.
back of a length and angling into Alam from wide of the crease, he stays back to defend into the covers
backs away and cuts Kallis behind square, but there is cover in the deep so just a single
short ball hurries through Haider before he is in position for the cut.
short ball well outside off and he cuts it behind square for one.
back of a length again and Fawad struggles to time it as he looks to cut and picks a single into the covers. The slow pitch has completely killed his strokeplay
short lifter and Haider is very late on the pull. He and Fawad are having diametrically opposite problems right now. Gets a healthy top edge over AB's head and through to the boundary

Fawad, at long last, connects with one. And only just. It was in the slot from Theron, full and just outside off and Fawad cleared the front foot away and launched it just over Tsotsobe's jump at mid on
hang on, is that the action replay? Seems so, Fawad again gones over mid on, Tsotsobe again leaps up from the edge of the circle at mid on and the ball again eludes him by a foot or so. Well, well..
slower ball, shorter and wider outside off and Fawad bottom edges the cut, on the bounce to AB
In the slot again and Alam goes down on a knee as he looks to slog it through midwicket. Reasonably well timed, but Tsotsobe who is now back on the long on boundary runs across to keep it to two
another slower ball, Alam opens the face and runs it straight to point. Direct hit would have ended Haider's throw, but JP misses the stumps

hang on, this game is not over! Theron bowls a perfect yorker on off stump and Haider backs away and has a flail at it. He gets a thick outside edge that scurries past to the left of short third man for four.
Fawad jumps out and looks to loft again, but gets an inside edge to short fine leg for a single

Haider has thrown it away, he really should have been looking for a single instead of standing tall and looking to drive majestically inside out, to a ball that was well short of driving length. He ended up scooping it straight up and into Amla's hands inside the circle at cover
Smoked! What a shot to start off. Morne gives him a foot of width outside off and Riaz opens his broad shoulders to crack that in the air through point. Four more
holds it back a touch and Riaz opens the face to dab it square for one towards point

Super shot from Alam! The field is in and now the timing is coming back. Short ball again from Morne and Alam likes the pace on the ball. He stays beside the line and crunches out a cut shot through the fielders inside the circle for four
Morne follows him and Alam is adept to work that off his body through square leg for one more
Alam advances down the track and Tsotsobe sends down a low full toss on the pads that Alam manages to flick through midwicket for a single

Riazzzzz! Backs away and sets himself up for a length ball. And guess what he got.. A length ball angling across in a friendly manner from leg stump to off and he swung a clean arc to send it soaring away towards the extra cover boundary. Pakistan are on the move!
Cramps him for room with one angling into Riaz as he backs away once again. Manages to drive it to cover for a single
and a wide down the leg. Dubai roars, Lonwabo feels the heat!

Alam was prancing around the crease as Lonwabo ran in and then pranced out to take it on the full. He could not time the swipe to the leg side and Botha inside the circle at midwicket collected and tried to throw down the stumps at the bowler's end. He missed
finally the yorker and Riaz can't do much as he backs away and sees if he can squeeze it through the off side
another good yorker, comes into Riaz and he does well to work it to short fine leg for a single.
short ball, Riaz looks to pull, can't connect and mistimes it to midwicket. It runs away slowly enough to ensure they pick two before the outfielder cleans up.

My oh my, Riaz has absolutely climbed into that one! What is Morne doing delivering a half tracker? Riaz seemed to see it early and he had the room again outside off to play his favourite carve over the covers. He timed it even better than the last time and it landed well over the extra cover fence

boy, is he hitting them. Length ball, Riaz brutalises it down the ground, and it nearly taked Morne with it. Brother Albie does extremely well to run across from wide long off and put the dive to stop it from reaching the fence
Morne spears it on the pads now and Riaz nudges it round to deep square leg for one more.

it's not working for South Africa and Pakistan are doing extremely well here. Alam backs his strengths this time and looks to cut a full and slow delivery outside off over the infield. It just cleared Duminy at point and Riaz ran like a monster to complete the third. This is exceptional cricket.

and another twist. Who's plotting the script of this game? Jeffrey Archer? Morne lands another short lifter outside off and Riaz gets an outside edge as he looked to cut, away from the body. AB pouches another important take
full on off stump and Alam can only drill a single down to long off. They don't need any risks from here, especially so with just 2 wickets in hand.
sensible. Ajmal waits for a length ball outside off and is almost on the run as he taps it into the covers. Single taken.

slow off cutter at 112 kph and Alam chips out and adjusts to the change of pace. He chips it down the ground for a single and brings up a spunky little fifty. He has gutsed it out in tough conditions.

both teams attempt suicide there! Pakistan survive. Ajmal works it off the pads straight to Ingram at midwicket and takes off. No single in that. Ingram collects and then throws it very wide of AB, who is forced to shy at thre stumps after collecting the throw. And he misses. That was a horror throw from Ingram
Asjaml looks to pull and has no clue where that went. It went behind point and they steal a leg bye
Alam has an almighty swoosh at a ball wide outside off and misses. Only 4 off that over.
well, what was that? Ajmal tries to do a Tillakaratne Dilshan to a ball angling across and well wide of off as he tries to paddle sweep. He misses and it is a dot
Lonwabo! What have you done! Wide down the leg. Not the time for an extra
Ajmal looks to cart him over extra cover and will be thankful about the lack of timing. It landed a few yards in front of Amla running in from the sweeper cover. Alam has strike now
well bowled Lonwabo. Alam backs away to the leg side, Lonwabo sees him and fires it at his legs and it goes through Alam down the leg side to the keeper

Alam goes aerial and Amla puts it down! That was in the slot for the slog and Alam looks to clear midwicket. He hits it far too high for his liking, and as it transpired, for Amla's too. He came running in as it swirled under the ring of fire and he grassed it. Fitting that the batsmen ran one short as they tried to take three
Ajmal looks to swing a length ball outside off and misses

and again, that one short really hurt Pakistan there! Alam was the culprit for the one short which ensured Ajmal had strike for the 5th ball, and this one. He swishes twice outside off and it is two dots.

starts with a very high full toss well wide outside off, and it is called no-ball for height! Alam keeps his wits about him and cross bats it away to deep extra cover for 2. 3 runs in all and the ball has to be rebowled! Come on Rusty!
manages to land this one and Alam looks to slog him across the line towards the leg side. He misses. Dot!

They are dropping everything! Alam looks to loft over extra cover and ends up scooping it straight up. Three fielders could have taken it, Albie running across from deep point settled under it and then let it go down. Two more taken. What a finish!
another short ball, Alam stays in the crease and looks to pull. He doesn't time the cross-batted swat, but manages to elude the infield and pick a couple to deep midwicket
Full outside off, Theron finally lands it on the money and Alam can't do much except squeeze it past the bowler to long on for one.
Ajmal is gone! Rusty hits the castle. Dubai goes quiet. It was back of a length outside off and Ajmal looked to tap it to the off side for one. He missed and it nipped the off bail out of the groove.

Rusty you beauty! Delivers the near-perfect yorker on off stump and Shoaib can't do much with that. It went off the edge, for a single to AB. Not enough. Johan Botha roars. Alam is heart-broken. South Africa have completed one of their narrowest wins by runs in ODIs.
